contentrichtext.text: [[File:Uncle Tobys Logo.jpg|thumb|right|Uncle Tobys' logo]] '''Uncle Tobys''' is an [[Australian]] brand of [[breakfast]] [[cereals]] and other breakfast food products. The brand has a lot of history and is mentioned in a 1892 newspaper.<ref>{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= |authorlink= | title=Commercial. | date=1892-11-18 | publisher= | url =http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/3551255#pstart104944 | work =The Brisbane Courier | pages =8 | accessdate = 2010-03-14 | language = }}</ref> Their main manufacturing base is located in the small town of [[Wahgunyah, Victoria|Wahgunyah]], on the [[New South Wales|NSW]] / [[Victoria (Australia)|Victorian]] Border. Uncle Tobys was formerly part of the [[Goodman Fielder]] food company, but was split off in December 2005 by parent company [[Burns Philp]]. In 2006 Uncle Tobys brands and manufacturing facility were purchased by Swiss food giant [[Nestlé]] S.A.<ref>{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= |authorlink= | title=Nestle clinches $890m Uncle Tobys deal. | date= 2006-05-23| publisher= | url =http://www.smh.com.au/news/business/nestle-clinches-890m-uncle-tobys-deal/2006/05/23/1148150241622.html | work =Sydney Morning Herald | pages = | accessdate = | language = }}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.uncletobys.com.au/ Uncle Tobys Website] *[http://www.uncletobys.co.nz/ New Zealand Uncle Tobys Website] {{Nestlé}} [[Category:Australian cuisine]] [[Category:Australian brands]] [[Category:Breakfast cereal companies]] {{Australia-company-stub}} {{food-product-stub}} {{breakfast-stub}} {{food-company-stub}}
